Create professional artwork using layers, masks, and blend modes
Apply color theory to create harmonious and impactful artwork
Develop efficient workflows that work across multiple applications
Build confidence in your digital artistry regardless of software choice

lessonCreationProcess.overview: Lessons are created incrementally using a fragment-based approach. Each lesson is broken into multiple HTML fragments (a, b, c, d, etc.) that are later concatenated into a complete lesson file. This allows for iterative review and correction during the creation process.

fragmentWorkflow.description: The creation process follows a strict iterative cycle
steps: 2. AI STOPS and waits for human review
3. Human reviews fragment A and provides feedback/corrections
4. AI makes any requested edits to fragment A
7. Repeat steps 2-6 for fragments C, D, E, etc. until lesson is complete
8. Concatenate all fragments into final lesson file
criticalRules: NEVER create multiple fragments without explicit approval
ALWAYS stop after creating each fragment
ALWAYS wait for human review before proceeding
EDIT existing fragments when changes are needed, don't rewrite
Ask for clarification if instructions are unclear

size.description: Each fragment should be manageable in size
guidelines: Not so large that review becomes overwhelming
Not so small that you have 20+ fragments

rules: Use underscores, not hyphens or spaces
Letter suffix (a, b, c, d, etc.) indicates fragment sequence
Filename matches the lesson's main filename from course-config.json

fragmentA.description: First fragment includes full HTML document setup
mustInclude: Complete <head> with meta tags, title, CSS links
Lesson header with title and lead paragraph
Table of Contents with all major sections
Comment indicating end of fragment A

fragmentBtoN.description: Middle fragments contain main content sections
mustInclude: Comment indicating start of fragment (e.g., <!-- PART B STARTS HERE -->)
Appropriate subsections, examples, and interactive demos
mustNotInclude: Body, nav, or structural opening tags

mustInclude: Comment indicating start of final fragment

tone.description: Write as an amazing instructor teaching new learners

softwareAgnostic.description: Content must work across ALL major digital art software
approach: Explain the underlying principle, not specific buttons
When showing software-specific info, include multiple programs
Use comparison tables for software differences
Focus on 'what' and 'why', not just 'how' in one app
